info.title: Variable Recurring Payments API
info.description: Variable Recurring Payments API for Open Banking Connector Web App

parameters.name: externalApiId
parameters.description: External (bank) API ID of Domestic VRP

BankProfileEnum.description:
Banks for which bank profiles have been created. Called BankProfileEnum to avoid confusion with the associated
class BankProfile.

Warnings.description: Optional list of warning messages from Open Banking Connector.

ExternalApiId.description:
External (bank) API ID. This should be unique between objects created at the
same bank but we do not assume global uniqueness between objects created at multiple banks.

ExternalApiUserId.description:
User ID at external API (bank) which may or may not be available via ID token "sub" claim. If retrieved from ID
token or supplied on object creation, it will be stored here.

Id.description: Unique Open Banking Connector ID (used in local database).

CreatedBy.description:
Optional "created by" string in local database. Similar to "modified by" for mutable fields in local database, this
field
can be used to denote authorship.

Reference.description:
Optional reference for linking object to something else - e.g. a user ID in the client
application. This field is not used by Open Banking Connector.

DomesticVrpConsentCreateResponse.description: Response to DomesticVrpConsent Create and Read requests.

BankRegistrationId.description: Specifies BankRegistration object to use when creating the consent.

ExternalApiUserId.description:
User ID at external API (bank) which may or may not be available via ID token "sub" claim. It can also optionally
be specified here.

Reference.description:
Optional reference for linking object to something else - e.g. a user ID in the client
application. This field is not used by Open Banking Connector.

CreatedBy.description:
Optional "created by" string in local database. Similar to "modified by" for mutable fields in local database, this
field
can be used to denote authorship.

Reference.description:
Optional reference for linking object to something else - e.g. a user ID in the client
application. This field is not used by Open Banking Connector.

CreatedBy.description:
Optional "created by" string in local database. Similar to "modified by" for mutable fields in local database, this
field
can be used to denote authorship.

Warnings.description: Optional list of warning messages from Open Banking Connector.

DomesticVrpResponse.description: Response to Read and Create requests

ExternalApiId.description:
External (bank) API ID, i.e. ID of object at bank. This should be unique between objects created at the
same bank but we do not assume global uniqueness between objects created at multiple banks.

SchemeName.description:
Gets or sets ^ 0..1) | `SchemeName` |Name of the identification
scheme, in a coded form as published in an external list.
|OBExternalFinancialInstitutionIdentification4Code

Identification.description:
Gets or sets ^ 0..1) | `Identification` |Unique and unambiguous
identification of a financial institution or a branch of a
financial institution.  | Max35Text

Name.description:
Gets or sets ^ 0..1) | `Name` | Name by which an agent is known and
which is usually used to identify that agent. | Max140Text

AddressType.description:
Gets or sets ^ 0..1) | `PostalAddress. AddressType` |Identifies the
nature of the postal address. |OBAddressTypeCode  |Business
Correspondence DeliveryTo MailTo POBox Postal Residential Statement

Department.description:
Gets or sets ^ 0..1) | `PostalAddress. Department` |Identification
of a division of a large organisation or building. | Max70Text

SubDepartment.description:
Gets or sets ^ 0..1) | `PostalAddress. SubDepartment`
|Identification of a sub-division of a large organisation or
building. |Max70Text

StreetName.description:
Gets or sets ^ 0..1) | `PostalAddress. StreetName`   |Name of a
street or thoroughfare.    |Max70Text

BuildingNumber.description:
Gets or sets ^ 0..1) | `PostalAddress. BuildingNumber` |Number that
identifies the position of a building on a street.   |Max16Text

PostCode.description:
Gets or sets ^ 0..1) | `PostalAddress. PostCode` |Identifier
consisting of a group of letters and. or numbers that is added to a
postal address to assist the sorting of mail.    |Max16Text

TownName.description:
Gets or sets ^ 0..1) | `PostalAddress. TownName` |Name of a
built-up area, with defined boundaries, and a local government.
|Max35Text

CountrySubDivision.description:
Gets or sets ^ 0..1) | `PostalAddress. CountrySubDivision`
|Identifies a subdivision of a country such as state, region,
county.      |Max35Text

Country.description:
Gets or sets ^ 0..1) | `PostalAddress. Country` | Nation with its
own government.      |CountryCode

OBBranchAndFinancialInstitutionIdentific.description:
^ 0..1) | `PostalAddress` |Information that locates and identifies a
specific address, as defined by postal services.| OBPostalAddress6

SchemeName.description:
Gets or sets ^ Name of the identification scheme, in a coded form
as published in an external list. | Namespaced Enumeration
OBExternalAccountIdentification4Code

Identification.description:
Gets or sets ^ Identification assigned by an institution to
identify an account. This identification is known by the account
owner. | Max256Text

Name.description:
Gets or sets ^ Name of the account, as assigned by the account
servicing institution.  Usage The account name is the name or names
of the account owner(s) represented at an account level. The
account name is not the product name or the nickname of the
account.

SecondaryIdentification.description:
Gets or sets ^ This is secondary identification of the account, as
assigned by the account servicing institution.  This can be used by
building societies to additionally identify accounts with a roll
number (in addition to a sort code and account number combination)
| Max34Text

SchemeName.description:
Gets or sets ^ Name of the identification scheme, in a coded form
as published in an external list. | Namespaced Enumeration
OBExternalAccountIdentification4Code

Identification.description:
Gets or sets ^ Identification assigned by an institution to
identify an account. This identification is known by the account
owner. | Max256Text

Name.description:
Gets or sets ^ Name of the account, as assigned by the account
servicing institution.  Usage The account name is the name or names
of the account owner(s) represented at an account level. The
account name is not the product name or the nickname of the
account.

SecondaryIdentification.description:
Gets or sets ^ This is secondary identification of the account, as
assigned by the account servicing institution.  This can be used by
building societies to additionally identify accounts with a roll
number (in addition to a sort code and account number combination)
| Max34Text

OBCashAccountDebtorWithName.description:
^ Only incuded in the response if `Data. ReadRefundAccount` is set to
`Yes` in the consent.

ConsentId.description:
Gets or sets unique identification as assigned by the ASPSP to
uniquely identify the consent resource.      | Max128Text

CreationDateTime.description:
Gets or sets date and time at which the resource was
created.|ISODateTime

Status.description:
Gets or sets specifies the status of resource in code form.
|Authorised AwaitingAuthorisation Rejected Revoked Expired

StatusUpdateDateTime.description:
Gets or sets date and time at which the resource status was
updated.  | ISODateTime

ValidFromDateTime.description:
Gets or sets ^ Start date time for which the consent remains valid.
| ISODateTime

ValidToDateTime.description:
Gets or sets ^ End date time for which the consent remains valid. |
ISODateTime

VRPType.description:
Gets or sets ^ The types of payments that can be made under this
VRP consent. This can be used to indicate whether this include
sweeping payment or other ecommerce payments.  | OBVRPConsentType -
Namespaced Enumeration

PSUAuthenticationMethods.description:
Gets or sets ^ Indicates that the PSU authentication methods
supported.  | OBVRPAuthenticationMethods - Namespaced Enumeration

SupplementaryData.description:
Gets or sets ^ Additional information that can not be captured in
the structured fields and/or any other specific block

Amount.description:
Gets or sets ^ A number of monetary units specified in an active
currency where the unit of currency is explicit and compliant with
ISO 4217.

Currency.description:
Gets or sets ^ A code allocated to a currency by a Maintenance
Agency under an international identification scheme, as described
in the latest edition of the international standard ISO 4217 "Codes
for the representation of currencies and funds".   |
ActiveOrHistoricCurrencyCode

Amount.description:
Gets or sets ^ A number of monetary units specified in an active
currency where the unit of currency is explicit and compliant with
ISO 4217.

Currency.description:
Gets or sets ^ A code allocated to a currency by a Maintenance
Agency under an international identification scheme, as described
in the latest edition of the international standard ISO 4217 "Codes
for the representation of currencies and funds".   |
ActiveOrHistoricCurrencyCode

Unstructured.description:
Gets or sets ^ Information supplied to enable the
matching/reconciliation of an entry with the items that the payment
is intended to settle, such as commercial invoices in an accounts'
receivable system, in an unstructured form.

Reference.description:
Gets or sets ^ Unique reference, as assigned by the creditor, to
unambiguously refer to the payment transaction. Usage - If
available, the initiating party should provide this reference in
the structured remittance information, to enable reconciliation by
the creditor upon receipt of the amount of money. If the business
context requires the use of a creditor reference or a payment remit
identification, and only one identifier can be passed through the
end-to-end chain, the creditor's reference or payment remittance
identification should be quoted in the end-to-end transaction
identification.

OBDomesticVRPInitiationRemittanceInforma.description:
^ Information supplied to enable the matching of an entry with the
items that the transfer is intended to settle, such as commercial
invoices in an accounts' receivable system.

InstructionIdentification.description:
Gets or sets unique identification as assigned by an instructing
party for an instructed party to unambiguously identify the
instruction.
Usage: the instruction identification is a point to point reference
that can be used between the instructing party and the instructed
party to refer to the individual instruction.
It can be included in several messages related to the instruction.

EndToEndIdentification.description:
Gets or sets unique identification assigned by the initiating party
to unambiguously identify the transaction.
This identification is passed on, unchanged, throughout the entire
end-to-end chain.
Usage: The end-to-end identification can be used for reconciliation
or to link tasks relating to the transaction.
It can be included in several messages related to the transaction.
OB: The Faster Payments Scheme can only access 31 characters for
the EndToEndIdentification field

SupplementaryData.description:
Gets or sets ^ Additional information that can not be captured in
the structured fields and/or any other specific block

ConsentId.description:
Gets or sets identifier for the Domestic VRP Consent that this
payment is made under.

PSUAuthenticationMethod.description:
Gets or sets ^ The authentication method that was used to
authenicate the PSU.   | OBVRPAuthenticationMethods - Namespaced
Enumeration

DomesticVRPId.description:
Gets or sets unique identification as assigned by the ASPSP to
uniquely identify the domestic payment resource.

ConsentId.description:
Gets or sets identifier for the Domestic VRP Consent that this
payment is made under.

CreationDateTime.description: Gets or sets date and time at which the resource was created.

StatusUpdateDateTime.description:
Gets or sets date and time at which the resource status was
updated.

ExpectedExecutionDateTime.description:
Gets or sets expected execution date and time for the payment
resource.

ExpectedSettlementDateTime.description:
Gets or sets expected settlement date and time for the payment
resource.

OBDomesticVRPResponseDataChargesItem.description:
Set of elements used to provide details of a charge for the payment
initiation.

MerchantCategoryCode.description:
Gets or sets category code conform to ISO 18245, related to the
type of services or goods the merchant provides for the
transaction.

MerchantCustomerIdentification.description:
Gets or sets the unique customer identifier of the PSU with the
merchant.

OBRisk1.description:
The Risk section is sent by the initiating party to the ASPSP. It is
used to specify additional details for risk scoring for Payments.

Country.description:
Gets or sets nation with its own government, occupying a particular
territory.

OBRisk1DeliveryAddress.description:
Information that locates and identifies a specific address, as defined
by postal services or in free format text.

Unstructured.description:
Gets or sets information supplied to enable the
matching/reconciliation of an entry with the items that the payment
is intended to settle, such as commercial invoices in an accounts'
receivable system, in an unstructured form.

Reference.description:
Gets or sets unique reference, as assigned by the creditor, to
unambiguously refer to the payment transaction. The PISP must
populate this with the same value as specified in the
ControlParameters.Reference field of the consent.

OBVRPRemittanceInformation.description:
Information supplied to enable the matching of an entry with the items
that the transfer is intended to settle, such as commercial invoices in
an accounts' receivable system.

Warnings.description: Optional list of warning messages from Open Banking Connector.
